content.description: Climb the slab it's only three or four moves to top out.  Don't use arÃªte.
content.location:
Boulder is Right next to the middle picnic table. Can't miss it!

Start as low as possible on the slab facing the road. There are two smaller rocks in front of the slab.

Echo picnic Area.

content.description: Fun V1-V2 sitting start. Some edges are sharp and will draw blood. Pretty fun to do while picnicking or waiting to get on the wall behind the boulder.
content.location: Picnic table side of boulder. Start Sitting both hands on obvious ledge and work straight up to top out.

content.description: Great place to teach rappelling.  I don't usually think places to rappel should be on a rock climbing site.  It gets tons of use.
content.protection: There are now (4) sets of bolts on the Rappel Buttress above Echo picnic site. Fall of 2016 there were only two.  It now could be super crowded up there if peoples are trying to use all 4 stations.
content.location: Just after the left turn onto SR 144 towards Tibble Fork Res. Echo is immediately on your left.  Careful not to park in the picnic areas if you're not going to picnic.  As you face the West the Buttress is to the SE up a fairly easy trial
